title: OnePlus 11 Concept brings water cooling to a phone with questionable results
description: OnePlus hypes up "Active CryoFlux" but even its own benchmarks aren't impressive.

title: More trepanation news: Evidence of brain surgery in Bronze Age Israel
description: Remains of one of two brothers found buried together showed signs of trepanation

title: SpaceX unveils “V2 Mini” Starlink satellites with quadruple the capacity
description: V2 Mini outperforms first-gen satellites, but full-size V2 must wait for Starship.

title: Lenovo demos laptop that rolls from 13 to 15 inches with the flip of a switch
description: OLED laptops with daringly versatile form factors have been a long time coming.

title: You can now search comments within a Reddit post—even on desktop
description: New Reddit gets a basic, long-requested feature at last.

title: Twitter Payments chief is out as layoffs cut 10% of Twitter staff, report says
description: Twitter now has fewer than 2,000 employees, The New York Times reported.

title: First Kindle Scribe software update begins closing the feature gap
description: Amazon hasn't said exactly what it plans, but the first new updates drop today.

title: West Virginia, Florida make moves to undermine science education
description: WV Senate OKs intelligent design bill; Florida's assault on education continues.

title: “Sorry in advance!” Snapchat warns of hallucinations with new AI conversation bot
description: "My AI" will cost $3.99 a month and "can be tricked into saying just about anything."

title: Conservative News Corp. empire says hackers were inside its network for 2 years
description: News Corp. disclosed the breach last year. Now, company says it lasted 23 months.

title: The “designed for reparability” Nokia G22 is just a normal cheap phone
description: HMD says it's "designed for reparability," but it's not much different from the G21.

title: Teens can proactively block their nude images from Instagram, OnlyFans
description: Hundreds already using tool, as teen financial sextortion cases are increasing.

title: VW wouldn’t help locate car with abducted child because GPS subscription expired

title: Linux is not exactly “ready to run” on Apple silicon, but give it time

title: Could deep boreholes solve our nuclear waste problem?
description: Small bore holes could provide an alternative to centralized waste repositories.

title: Shortly before liftoff, SpaceX cancels a crew launch due to igniter issues
description: "Standing down from tonight's launch of Crew-6 due to a TEA-TEB ground system issue."

title: Where a kid can be a kid: Recapping episode 7 of HBO’s The Last of Us
description: Kyle and Andrew make sure no insight gets "Left Behind" in this DLC-inspired episode.
